snippet.textDisplay: This is one of the best series I've played, hands-down.  An action RPG mixed in with a building sim.  It's a wonderful feeling going through a town that was all but destroyed when you got there and seeing it slowly recover by your own hand.
snippet.textOriginal: This is one of the best series I've played, hands-down.  An action RPG mixed in with a building sim.  It's a wonderful feeling going through a town that was all but destroyed when you got there and seeing it slowly recover by your own hand.

snippet.textDisplay: I want part 3 in PS3 so bad...the graphics in ps3 would make this game really really great...but remember if any of the ppl working in the industry read this (tho i highly doubt) that this game has always been simple, but really enjoying, with great music and an appreciation to nature. Last but most important, the ability to do your own things (building houses, allocating them, weapons upgrade, etc.).
snippet.textOriginal: I want part 3 in PS3 so bad...the graphics in ps3 would make this game really really great...but remember if any of the ppl working in the industry read this (tho i highly doubt) that this game has always been simple, but really enjoying, with great music and an appreciation to nature. Last but most important, the ability to do your own things (building houses, allocating them, weapons upgrade, etc.).

snippet.textDisplay:
Dark Chronical has to be, I think anyway, the greatest example of gameplay improvements through a sequel.

Dark Cloud was great, but there were a lot of bad design choices when making it. Weapons take damage if you're blocking? You get thirsty in dungeons? If a weapon breaks it's gone forever? And there were just too many characters, really. Too many weapons to juggle.
snippet.textOriginal:
Dark Chronical has to be, I think anyway, the greatest example of gameplay improvements through a sequel.

Dark Cloud was great, but there were a lot of bad design choices when making it. Weapons take damage if you're blocking? You get thirsty in dungeons? If a weapon breaks it's gone forever? And there were just too many characters, really. Too many weapons to juggle.

snippet.textDisplay:
I wouldn't say every song is epic...

Black Shadows among others is noticeably more "midi-like" compared to an inspired song like The Demon Shaft, Owl Forest, Sinking Ship, and Corridor of Time
